caption: Table 1: Quantitative comparison with baselines
description: This table presents a quantitative comparison of the proposed method against several baseline models for brain CT-to-MRI translation.  The comparison is done using three metrics: Normalized Root Mean Square Error (NRMSE), Peak Signal-to-Noise Ratio (PSNR), and Structural Similarity Index Measure (SSIM).  Results are shown for both an in-house CT-MRI dataset and the FLAIR-T1 MRI dataset from BraTS2023.  The metrics provide an objective evaluation of the image quality and similarity between the generated MRI images and the ground truth MRI images.

caption: Table 2: Quantitative results of ablation studies.
description: This table presents a quantitative analysis of the impact of different components of the proposed method on the performance of 3D brain CT-to-MRI translation. It compares the results obtained using the full model (Oursbest) against several ablation variants: using only the 2D Brownian Bridge Diffusion Model (Pure BBDM); incorporating Style Key Conditioning (SKC) with either a Colin27 average brain histogram or the average histogram from the training dataset; adding Inter-Slice Trajectory Alignment (ISTA) with and without the correction step; and a combination of SKCavg and ISTA with only the co-prediction step. The comparison is made across two metrics (NRMSE, PSNR, SSIM) for both the in-house CT-MRI dataset and the BraTS2023 FLAIR-T1 dataset.
